body_html:
Thanks for the report, @docsjoo. I believe this has been fixed on master already:

In [3]: import numpy as np
   ...: import torch
   ...: from torch.autograd import Variable
   ...: a = np.arange(10)
   ...: b = np.zeros([10])
   ...: c = np.zeros([1,1,10])
   ...: p = a > 5
   ...: at = torch.arange(10)
   ...: bt = torch.zeros(10)
   ...: ct = torch.zeros(1,1,10)
   ...: ct[:,:,p]
   ...:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
IndexError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-3-d0f58b700302> in <module>()
      9 bt = torch.zeros(10)
     10 ct = torch.zeros(1,1,10)
---> 11 ct[:,:,p]

IndexError: When performing advanced indexing the indexing objects must be LongTensors or convertible to LongTensors. The indexing object at posi
tion 2 is of type numpy.ndarray and cannot be converted

The fix will be in the next release.

body:
Thanks for the report, @docsjoo. I believe this has been fixed on master already:
```
In [3]: import numpy as np
   ...: import torch
   ...: from torch.autograd import Variable
   ...: a = np.arange(10)
   ...: b = np.zeros([10])
   ...: c = np.zeros([1,1,10])
   ...: p = a > 5
   ...: at = torch.arange(10)
   ...: bt = torch.zeros(10)
   ...: ct = torch.zeros(1,1,10)
   ...: ct[:,:,p]
   ...:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
IndexError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-3-d0f58b700302> in <module>()
      9 bt = torch.zeros(10)
     10 ct = torch.zeros(1,1,10)
---> 11 ct[:,:,p]

IndexError: When performing advanced indexing the indexing objects must be LongTensors or convertible to LongTensors. The indexing object at posi
tion 2 is of type numpy.ndarray and cannot be converted
```

The fix will be in the next release.
